bwwExcerpt: As the sequences of Edward's fantasies play out, however, the father-son story is frequently lost in the whimsicality rather than enhanced by it. It's only near the very end, when Will learns what Edward has accomplished and comes to appreciate the value of a man telling stories, that all the elements properly converge.

keyPhrases.quote: the father-son story is frequently lost in the whimsicality rather than enhanced by it
